column4: the system generally crawls - from window rendering to actually launching applications

512MB for a 1GHz machine?
isn't that overkill?
and generally slow performance :p

blanky- mines only a 1GHz but even windows runs faster than this

I have Athlon 1.2ghz and adding another 256mb means never using swap in my experience

- the hard drive light is hardly ever lit - i dont think its swapping
well if you can afford it...extra memory will not go wrong
386 kernel?
- no, Linux kernal#
I have asus mb with athlon 1.2 512mb ram and geforce3 vidcard...not much different than you

- it calls it by it's name, yes
